title: Eight things Patriots must do to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots need an MVP performance from QB Drake Maye to overcome Seattle's strong defense in Super Bowl LX.
New England's defensive strategy includes pressuring Seattle's QB Sam Darnold and covering WR Jaxon Smith-Njigba closely.
Patriots must limit Seattle's run game, protect Maye, and capitalize on explosive plays for a Super Bowl win.

title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest adopted the No. 55 jersey at USC due to a tradition started by linebacker Junior Seau.
McGinest wore No. 55 for the Patriots from 1994-2005, contributing to three Super Bowl wins.
Junior Seau, after joining the Patriots in 2006, asked McGinest's permission to wear the No. 55 jersey.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County recorded the highest snow totals with Salisbury and Beverly each receiving 13 inches on February 7, 2026.
Bristol County saw Dartmouth hit 8.2 inches and Rehoboth reach 6.5 inches during the winter storm.
The northeastern part of Massachusetts was mainly impacted, with several towns reporting over 10 inches of snow.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC during Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks.
Tirico will follow up the Super Bowl broadcast by hosting NBC’s Olympic studio program from Levi's Stadium.
Alongside Tirico, Cris Collinsworth will be the analyst for the game, while Maria Taylor handles pregame hosting.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium as a 4.5-point underdog.
Quarterback Drake Maye could become the youngest to win a Super Bowl if the Patriots succeed.
Seahawks led NFL in scoring defense, presenting a strong challenge against Patriots' high-scoring offense.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel sought guidance from Bill Belichick, Andy Reid, and Josh McDaniels for his first Super Bowl coaching.
Vrabel led Patriots to 14 wins and won Coach of the Year after two consecutive four-win seasons.
Patriots mimicked halftime strategies from Belichick and Reid, including a locker room break during practice.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots seek a record seventh Super Bowl title, potentially surpassing Pittsburgh for most in NFL history.
Quarterback Drake Maye aims to join elite company as a second-year Super Bowl winner alongside Tom Brady.
A Patriots victory would make Mike Vrabel the first to win a Super Bowl with the same team as player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs seeks a Hall of Fame boost with a potential Super Bowl LX win.
Diggs has 11,504 receiving yards and 73 touchdowns, ranking 38th and 43rd all-time, respectively.
Diggs's Hall of Fame prospects face challenges, with 22 wide receivers ranked higher on Pro Football Reference's monitor.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former Patriots and Colts kicker, was named to the Pro Football Hall of Fame's 2026 class.
Vinatieri scored 2,673 points over 24 NFL seasons, holding records for most points and consecutive field goals.
Vinatieri is celebrated for his game-winning field goals, including two in Super Bowl victories with the Patriots.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel simulated a longer halftime break during Patriots' final practice for Super Bowl LX preparation.
Patriots QB Drake Maye fully participated in practice despite a previous shoulder issue, alongside limited teammates Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane.
Rookie Joshua Farmer remains questionable for the game, still recovering from a hamstring injury after being designated to return from injured reserve.
